current_task.title: Add reverse proxy config (Caddy) to docker-compose
current_task.description:
Add Caddy as a reverse proxy to route traffic appropriately. Caddy will be the single entry point for external traffic.

Routing requirements:
1. Route /_matrix/* to synapse:8008 (Matrix homeserver APIs)
2. Route / (everything else) to hush:3001 (the Hush client/server)
3. Configure CORS headers for Matrix client access
4. Use Caddy's automatic HTTPS (disabled for localhost development)

Notes:
- The Hush service currently exposes port 3001 - Caddy will proxy to it
- Synapse is on port 8008 internally
- For local dev, use http://localhost as the site address
- Ensure WebSocket upgrade headers are passed through for Socket.io
acceptance_criteria: WebSocket upgrade headers (Connection, Upgrade) are preserved
Caddy depends on synapse and hush services
Port 80 (and optionally 443) exposed on caddy service
